User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/534.30 (KHTML, like Gecko) Ubuntu/10.10 Chromium/12.0.742.91 Chrome/12.0.742.91 Safari/534.30

Steps to reproduce:

localStorage.removeItem does not remove item completely. You can run following scenario in FireBug:
>>> localStorage['a'] = 'b'
>>> 'a' in localStorage
true
>>> localeStorage.removeItem('a')
>>> 'a' in localStorage
true << must be false
>>> localStorage.length
0 << but 'a' is in localStorage
>>> localStorage['a']
null
> delete localStorage['a']
> 'a' in localStorage
false



Actual results:

FireFox behaves different from other browsers.


Expected results:

Item must be removed completely.

I have set up a JSFiddle as part of a blog post on browser inconsistencies w.r.t. removing items from localStorage.  Part of the series of tests highlights the "'a' in localStorage" inconsistency.

http://jsfiddle.net/shane_tomlinson/N64fG/

This affects Firefox 12 through Nightly (2012.05.04) on OSX.
